titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid to the Long Point Gallery Records, 1959-1999, bulk 1976-1998, in the Archives of American Art AAA.longpoin
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Sarah Mundy

note.p: This finding aid is associated with a MARC collection-level record. 220265

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2014-09-04T08:38-0400

did.abstract: The records of the Long Point Gallery measure 7.1 linear feet and date from 1959 to 1999, bulk 1976 to 1998. The collection documents the history of the gallery through administrative records, guest books, correspondence, exhibition files, artists' files, financial records, printed material, and photographic materials.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Use of original papers requires an appointment. Use of archival audiovisual recordings with no duplicate access copy requires advance notice.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: The Long Point Gallery records are owned by the Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution. Literary rights as possessed by the donor have been dedicated to public use for research, study, and scholarship. The collection is subject to all copyright laws.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Donated in 1999 and 2013 by the Long Point Gallery via Rosalind Pace, former Director.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Long Point Gallery (est. 1977, closed 1998) was a cooperative art gallery in Provincetown, Massachusetts. The gallery operated in the American Legion building during the summer seasons as an artist cooperative. Members contributed financially, as well as artistically, enabling the promotion and preparation of exhibitions throughout the summer. The founding members were Varujan Boghosian, Fritz Bultman, Carmen Cicero, Sideo Fromboluti, Edward Giobbi, Budd Hopkins, Rick Klauber, Leo Manso, Robert Motherwell, Paul Resika, Judith Rothschild, Sidney Simon, Nora Speyer, and Tony Vevers. Later in the gallery's history Robert Beauchamp, Paul Bowen, Gilbert Franklin, Dimitri Hadzi, Renate Ponsold, and Michael Mazur also became members. Some notable friends of the gallery were Nassos Daphnis, Jack Tworkov, and Myron Stout. The gallery's first director was Rick Librizzi.

The Long Point Gallery gained a reputation for showing progressive, expressionist and abstract paintings and sculptures that veered away from the traditional tourist scenes of Cape Cod. During the 1980's, Provincetown was becoming a popular tourist destination, which caused real estate values to climb. Fortunately, members of the cooperative were able to afford the rising costs and remain in Provincetown allowing the gallery to become a fixture within the community. The gallery often held dual exhibits featuring two artists who presented their artwork individually. Other exhibitions include "Homeric Themes" (1987), "Myth & Ritual" (1989), "From the Studio Wall" (1990), "A Long Point Portfolio" (1991), "Keyworks" (1991), "Those Lovely Golden Thighs" (1991), and "A Story to Tell" (1996). Members also represented the Long Point Gallery in exhibitions at the Fine Arts Work Center (FAWC), the Cape Museum of Fine Arts (CMFA), the Archives of American Art, and exhibitions in Europe. For over 20 years, the Long Point Gallery was the site of art exhibitions, poetry readings, musical performances, and parties until its closing in 1998.

In 1998, the American Legion building was sold at a price that was too high for the gallery to continue in the same location. The advanced ages and deaths of a few members prior to the sale of the building contributed to the members' decision to dissolve the gallery, which was under the direction of Rosalind Pace at the time of closing.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The records of the Long Point Gallery measure 7.1 linear feet and date from 1959 to 1999, bulk 1976 to 1998. The collection documents the history of the gallery through administrative records, guest books, correspondence, exhibition files, artists' files, financial records, printed material, and photographic materials.

Administrative records consist of legal documents, contracts, mailing lists, price lists, membership files, correspondence, meeting minutes, gallery history, projects files, and one videocassette of the Long Point Gallery dinner filmed by Renate Ponsold Motherwell in 1993. Guest books document the signatures and salutations of attendees at gallery exhibitions. Correspondence is with artists, organizations, and gallery customers. Exhibition files contain correspondence, press releases, articles, and exhibition announcements. Artists' files consist of news clippings, exhibition records, price lists, and correspondence. Financial records contain bills, receipts, deposits, financial reports, gallery sales, and records for the transport of artwork. Printed material includes news clippings, exhibition announcements and catalogs, press releases, obituaries, publications, souvenirs, and posters signed by the artists. Photographic materials include slides and printed photographs of artwork, artists, exhibitions, parties, and candid moments. Overall the collection documents the activities of artist members, including Varujan Boghosian, Fritz Bultman, Carmen Cicero, Sideo Fromboluti, Edward Giobbi, Budd Hopkins, Rick Klauber, Leo Manso, Robert Motherwell, Paul Resika, Judith Rothschild, Sidney Simon, Nora Speyer, Tony Vevers, Robert Beauchamp, Paul Bowen, Gilbert Franklin, Dimitri Hadzi, Renate Ponsold, and Michael Mazur.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: Long Point Gallery records, 1959-1999, bulk 1976-1998. Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: The collection was processed to a minimal level and a finding aid prepared by Sarah Mundy in 2014. The collection has been minimally rearranged and retains the existing/original folder titles when possible. All materials have been rehoused in archival folders and boxes for long-term stability, but often staples and other fasteners have not been removed. Materials within folders have not been rearranged.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged as 8 series.

list.item: Series 1: Administrative Records, 1976-1999 (1.5 linear ft.; Box 1-2)
Series 4: Exhibition Files, 1959-1998, bulk 1972-1998 (0.6 linear ft.; Box 3-4)
Series 5: Artists' Files, 1963-1997 (0.8 linear ft.; Box 4)
Series 6: Financial Records, 1976-1998 (0.8 linear ft.; Box 5)
Series 7: Printed Material, 1972-1998 (0.8 linear ft.; Box 5-6, OV 8)
Series 8: Photographic Materials, 1972-1998 (1.5 linear ft.; Box 6-7)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Administrative records contain price lists, meeting minutes, appraisals, mailing lists for event invitiations, an appointment book, contracts, lists of collectors, and a history and bibliography of the Long Point Gallery. This series also contains files on contributions and gifts including documents regarding 12 prints that were donated to the Museum of Fine Arts in Boston and Robert Beauchamp's bequest of a set of works on paper to Long Point Gallery. The Judith Rothschild Foundation file includes a color photograph of Rothschild in her studio along with receipt of delivery paperwork, correspondence, and press releases. Other notable records are the original signatures for several of the Long Point members and one videocassette of the Long Point Gallery dinner filmed by Renate Ponsold Motherwell in 1993.

did.unittitle: Mailing List of Artists and Collectors
Museum of Fine Arts, Boston, Gift

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Guest books include seven books that are arranged chonologically by year. They contain the signatures and salutations of visitors to the Long Point Gallery from around the world. The pages of the books are labeled with dates and exhibition titles.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence contains a mixture of original and photocopied correspondence between Long Point and other art galleries, collectors, customers, members, and art related organizations. This series may also contain price lists, notes, articles, and press releases that were attached to letters. A bulk of the correspondence is business related but more personal letters to and from artist members and gallery staff are scattered throughout the series.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Folders are arranged chonologically by exhibition year.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Exhibition files document over 50 exhibitions held at the Long Point Gallery, the Fine Arts Work Center (FAWC), the Cape Museum of Fine Arts (CMFA), the Cultural Festival in Prague, Czech Republic, and the "A Long Point Portfolio" exhibit at the Belltable Arts Centre in Limerick, Ireland. Long Point often held dual exhibits where two artists showed their work simultaneously. Dual exhibitions are indicated in this finding aid with exhibition titles containing two artists names. Files may include correspondence, notes, news clippings, printed material, and price lists related to each exhibition.

did.unittitle: "A Selection of Work by Former Fellows of the Fine Arts Work Center, Provincetown" (1980)
Reading at Long Point, Rosalind Price
"A Long Point Portfolio"(1991), Belltable Arts Center
"Provincetown Papers: Selections from New Collections"(1997), Archives of American Art

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Folders are arranged alphabetically by the artists' last name.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Artists' files consist of documents pertaining to the members of Long Point Gallery. These files may contain correspondence, price lists, printed material, notes, resumes, and photographs of artwork. Files for Robert Motherwell total nine folders with six folders containing pricing and inventory information on his prints.

did.unittitle: Motherwell, Robert, Prints and Price Lists

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Financial records consist of financial reports, bills and receipts, expense reports, ledgers, gallery sales, and several folders containing records on shipping and the transportation of artwork by truck. Files may also contain related correspondence, price lists, and notes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Printed material mainly consists of original and photocopied news articles regarding Long Point members and exhibitions. Also included are exhibition announcements and catalogs, obituaries, and several arts publications. Reproductions include notecards showing artwork, photocopies of a sketch of a woman's face, and one poster. Other posters signed by the artists are included in oversized material.

did.unittitle: Press Coverage: The Long Point Gallery Provincetown

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photographic material consists of prints, negatives, and slides that document various parties, exhibitions, artwork, and Long Point artists. Included are photographs of the artists behind the scenes at exhibitions assisting with hanging artwork and gallery preparations. Group photographs of artist members taken by Renate Ponsold and Joel Meyerowitz are included, as well as individual portraits of several of the artists. Photographs and slides of exhibitions include individual photographs of the artwork, views of the exhibition space, and exhibition attendees. The bulk of the photographs and slides are labeled.

did.unittitle: Negative and Contact Prints of Artwork and Exhibitions
